newsitem.title: UK: East Midlands gains amid fresh bid talk.
newsitem.headline: East Midlands gains amid fresh bid talk.

text.p: Shares in Britain's East Midlands Electricity Plc sparked higher on Thursday amid a fresh outbreak of bid speculation, traders and analysts said.
The stock was up 20-1/2p at 519-1/2 bu 0835 GMT, continuing a rebound since it touched a 19-month low of 477p on October 17.
"There's just been a bit of speculation that there could be some action," said a market-maker at one brokerage, "it always comes and goes."
Said another: "We have seen a bit of interest, it seems to be seen as a takeover target."
Chris Perry, analyst at Charterhouse Tilney, said he was not surprised to see a resurgence of takeover speculation in the stock.

"At the time of its last results, the company effectively indicated its surprise that it hadn't been taken over, their shares had fallen back a long way and it's perhaps no surprise that bid rumours are re-emerging."
He said interest in the electricity sector could revive ahead of the results season which kicks off with figures from Southern Electric Plc at the end of November.
"There is going to be a big focus on the ability of these companies to hand out more cash... if the results season is not going to get it going, then nothing will."
Among other electricity stocks London Electricity Plc was up 7p at 573-1/2, Northern Electric Plc was up 5p at 495 and Yorkshire Electricity Plc was up 6p at 723-1/2.
